page.title: 18WILDLIFE AROUND MINSTERLEY
page.content: Our school is surrounded by woods & farmland & the grounds are bordered at the back by{willow trees & Minsterley brook.The grounds have lots of trees like{Western red cedar,ash, {cherry, alder & silver birch.We}also have a sports field. Many kinds of birds come to the school grounds. In Winter{redwings & fieldfares come to the field.There is a bird table for{thrushes, blackbirds, {greenfinches & chaffinches.One cold Winter{bramblings & a greater spotted {woodpecker}were seen. In Spring some birds nest in our nestboxes like{tree sparrows, robins, {spotted flycatchers & bluetits. {Starlings}nest in holes,{jackdaws}in a chimneypot &{swifts}on the school wall. A{heron}sometimes flies over & {dippers}live by the stream.
